name: CSV LLM Iterator
description:
Load a CSV file, convert its contents into data objects, process each item using an LLM with dynamic prompts, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.

 (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

data_list.name: data_list
data_list.info: The list of data to iterate over.

llm.name: llm
llm.info: The language model to use for processing.

code.value:
import csv
import os
from typing import List
from loguru import logger

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import (
    MessageTextInput,
    IntInput,
    DataInput,
    Output,
    MultilineInput,
    HandleInput,
    StrInput,
)
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class DynamicLLMDataIteratorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Dynamic LLM Data Iterator"
    description = (
        "Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, "
        "store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.\n\n"
        "- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).\n"
        "- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.\n"
        "- Optional: Provide a path to save the processed data as a CSV file.\n"
    )
    icon = "ðŸ”"
    base_type = "component"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data_list", display_name="Data List", info="The list of data to iterate over.", is_list=True),
        IntInput(name="start_index", display_name="Start Index", info="The index to start processing from.", value=0),
        IntInput(name="iteration_count", display_name="Iteration Count", info="Number of items to process. Set to 0 to process all remaining items.", value=0),
        MultilineInput(
            name="prompt_template",
            display_name="Prompt Template",
            info="The prompt template to use for each item. Use `{key}` to refer to values in the data. For example, 'Based on the domain {Domain} and the meta {Meta}, do X'.",
            value="Based on the domain {Domain} and the meta {Meta}, do X",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(name="output_key", display_name="Output Key", info="The key to store the LLM output in the data."),
        HandleInput(
            name="llm",
            display_name="LLM",
            input_types=["LanguageModel"],
            info="The language model to use for processing.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="file_path",
            display_name="CSV File Path",
            info="The path to save the CSV file. If not provided, no CSV will be saved.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Processed Data", name="processed_data", method="process_data"),
    ]

    def append_to_csv(self, file_path: str, data: dict):
        file_exists = os.path.isfile(file_path)
        
        with open(file_path, 'a', newline='') as csvfile:
            writer = csv.DictWriter(csvfile, fieldnames=data.keys())
            
            if not file_exists:
                writer.writeheader()
            
            writer.writerow(data)

    def construct_prompt(self, template: str, data: dict) -> str:
        return template.format(**data)

    def process_data(self) -> List[Data]:
        logger.info("Starting data processing")
        data_list: List[Data] = self.data_list
        start_index: int = max(0, self.start_index)  # Ensure start_index is not negative
        iteration_count: int = self.iteration_count
        prompt_template: str = self.prompt_template
        output_key: str = self.output_key
        file_path: str = self.file_path

        logger.debug(f"Number of data items: {len(data_list)}")
        logger.debug(f"Start index: {start_index}")
        logger.debug(f"Iteration count: {iteration_count}")
        logger.debug(f"Prompt template: {prompt_template}")
        logger.debug(f"Output key: {output_key}")
        logger.debug(f"CSV file path: {file_path}")

        llm = self.llm

        # Adjust iteration_count based on start_index and remaining items
        if iteration_count <= 0 or (start_index + iteration_count) > len(data_list):
            iteration_count = len(data_list) - start_index
        
        end_index = start_index + iteration_count
        logger.info(f"Will process items from index {start_index} to {end_index - 1}")

        processed_data = []

        for index, item in enumerate(data_list[start_index:end_index], start=start_index):
            logger.debug(f"Processing item {index}/{end_index - 1}")
            if not isinstance(item.data, dict):
                logger.error(f"Data item {index} is not a dictionary")
                raise ValueError(f"Data item {index} is not a dictionary")

            prompt = self.construct_prompt(prompt_template, item.data)
            logger.debug(f"Generated prompt: {prompt}")
            
            try:
                logger.debug("Invoking LLM")
                llm_output = llm.invoke(prompt).content
                logger.debug(f"LLM output: {llm_output}")
                new_item = item.data.copy()
                new_item[output_key] = llm_output
                processed_data.append(Data(data=new_item))
                logger.info(f"Successfully processed item {index}")
                
                if file_path:
                    self.append_to_csv(file_path, new_item)
                    logger.info(f"Appended item {index} to CSV")
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Error processing item {index}: {str(e)}")
                self.status = f"Error processing item {index}: {str(e)}"
                return processed_data

        self.status = processed_data
        logger.info(f"Finished processing. {len(processed_data)} items processed successfully.")
        return processed_data
code.name: code

file_path.name: file_path
file_path.info: The path to save the CSV file. If not provided, no CSV will be saved.

iteration_count.name: iteration_count
iteration_count.info: Number of items to process. Set to 0 to process all remaining items.

output_key.name: output_key
output_key.info: The key to store the LLM output in the data.

Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.

- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).
- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.
- Optional: Provide a path to save the processed data as a CSV file.

Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.

- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).
- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.

import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    MessageInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict)
        seed = self.seed
        model_kwargs["seed"] = seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
        )
        if json_mode:
            output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return

code_File-LWAuh.value:
from pathlib import Path

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file loader."
    icon = "file-text"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        data = parse_text_file_to_data(resolved_path, silent_errors)
        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()
code_File-LWAuh.name: code

silent_errors_File-LWAuh.name: silent_errors
silent_errors_File-LWAuh.info: If true, errors will not raise an exception.

code_CustomComponent-hHbc0.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import csv
from io import StringIO

class CSVToDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "CSV to Data"
    description = "Convert a CSV string to a list of Data objects"
    icon = "ðŸ“Š"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="csv_string",
            display_name="CSV String",
            info="Enter a valid CSV string to convert to a list of Data objects",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(name="data_list", display_name="Data List", method="convert_csv_to_data"),
    ]

    def convert_csv_to_data(self) -> list[Data]:
        try:
            csv_string = self.csv_string

            # Use StringIO to create a file-like object from the string
            csv_file = StringIO(csv_string)

            # Create a CSV reader object
            csv_reader = csv.DictReader(csv_file)

            # Convert each row to a Data object
            result = []
            for row in csv_reader:
                result.append(Data(data=row))

            self.status = result
            return result

        except csv.Error as e:
            error_message = f"CSV parsing error: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            return [Data(data={"error": error_message})]

        except Exception as e:
            error_message = f"An error occurred: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            return [Data(data={"error": error_message})]
code_CustomComponent-hHbc0.name: code

code_ParseData-zTvi2.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
code_ParseData-zTvi2.name: code

template_ParseData-zTvi2.name: template
template_ParseData-zTvi2.info: The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.

from pathlib import Path

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file loader."
    icon = "file-text"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        data = parse_text_file_to_data(resolved_path, silent_errors)
        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text

from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"

    icon = "braces"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)

import csv
import os
from typing import List
from loguru import logger

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import (
    MessageTextInput,
    IntInput,
    DataInput,
    Output,
    MultilineInput,
    HandleInput,
    StrInput,
)
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class DynamicLLMDataIteratorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Dynamic LLM Data Iterator"
    description = (
        "Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, "
        "store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.\n\n"
        "- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).\n"
        "- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.\n"
        "- Optional: Provide a path to save the processed data as a CSV file.\n"
    )
    icon = "ðŸ”"
    base_type = "component"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data_list", display_name="Data List", info="The list of data to iterate over.", is_list=True),
        IntInput(name="start_index", display_name="Start Index", info="The index to start processing from.", value=0),
        IntInput(name="iteration_count", display_name="Iteration Count", info="Number of items to process. Set to 0 to process all remaining items.", value=0),
        MultilineInput(
            name="prompt_template",
            display_name="Prompt Template",
            info="The prompt template to use for each item. Use `{key}` to refer to values in the data. For example, 'Based on the domain {Domain} and the meta {Meta}, do X'.",
            value="Based on the domain {Domain} and the meta {Meta}, do X",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(name="output_key", display_name="Output Key", info="The key to store the LLM output in the data."),
        HandleInput(
            name="llm",
            display_name="LLM",
            input_types=["LanguageModel"],
            info="The language model to use for processing.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="file_path",
            display_name="CSV File Path",
            info="The path to save the CSV file. If not provided, no CSV will be saved.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Processed Data", name="processed_data", method="process_data"),
    ]

    def append_to_csv(self, file_path: str, data: dict):
        file_exists = os.path.isfile(file_path)
        
        with open(file_path, 'a', newline='') as csvfile:
            writer = csv.DictWriter(csvfile, fieldnames=data.keys())
            
            if not file_exists:
                writer.writeheader()
            
            writer.writerow(data)

    def construct_prompt(self, template: str, data: dict) -> str:
        return template.format(**data)

    def process_data(self) -> List[Data]:
        logger.info("Starting data processing")
        data_list: List[Data] = self.data_list
        start_index: int = max(0, self.start_index)  # Ensure start_index is not negative
        iteration_count: int = self.iteration_count
        prompt_template: str = self.prompt_template
        output_key: str = self.output_key
        file_path: str = self.file_path

        logger.debug(f"Number of data items: {len(data_list)}")
        logger.debug(f"Start index: {start_index}")
        logger.debug(f"Iteration count: {iteration_count}")
        logger.debug(f"Prompt template: {prompt_template}")
        logger.debug(f"Output key: {output_key}")
        logger.debug(f"CSV file path: {file_path}")

        llm = self.llm

        # Adjust iteration_count based on start_index and remaining items
        if iteration_count <= 0 or (start_index + iteration_count) > len(data_list):
            iteration_count = len(data_list) - start_index
        
        end_index = start_index + iteration_count
        logger.info(f"Will process items from index {start_index} to {end_index - 1}")

        processed_data = []

        for index, item in enumerate(data_list[start_index:end_index], start=start_index):
            logger.debug(f"Processing item {index}/{end_index - 1}")
            if not isinstance(item.data, dict):
                logger.error(f"Data item {index} is not a dictionary")
                raise ValueError(f"Data item {index} is not a dictionary")

            prompt = self.construct_prompt(prompt_template, item.data)
            logger.debug(f"Generated prompt: {prompt}")
            
            try:
                logger.debug("Invoking LLM")
                llm_output = llm.invoke(prompt).content
                logger.debug(f"LLM output: {llm_output}")
                new_item = item.data.copy()
                new_item[output_key] = llm_output
                processed_data.append(Data(data=new_item))
                logger.info(f"Successfully processed item {index}")
                
                if file_path:
                    self.append_to_csv(file_path, new_item)
                    logger.info(f"Appended item {index} to CSV")
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Error processing item {index}: {str(e)}")
                self.status = f"Error processing item {index}: {str(e)}"
                return processed_data

        self.status = processed_data
        logger.info(f"Finished processing. {len(processed_data)} items processed successfully.")
        return processed_data
code.name: code

file_path.name: file_path
file_path.info: The path to save the CSV file. If not provided, no CSV will be saved.

iteration_count.name: iteration_count
iteration_count.info: Number of items to process. Set to 0 to process all remaining items.

output_key.name: output_key
output_key.info: The key to store the LLM output in the data.

prompt_template.value: Based on the domain {Domain}, your response should contain ONLY the name of the country of origin of that domain.
prompt_template.name: prompt_template
prompt_template.info: The prompt template to use for each item. Use `{key}` to refer to values in the data. For example, 'Based on the domain {Domain} and the meta {Meta}, do X'.

start_index.name: start_index
start_index.info: The index to start processing from.

node.description:
Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.

- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).
- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.
- Optional: Provide a path to save the processed data as a CSV file.

data.description:
Iterate over a list of data, process each item using a specified LLM with a dynamically constructed prompt, store the result, and optionally save the results to a CSV file.

- Define a prompt template using placeholders for data keys (e.g., `{key_1}`, `{key_2}`).
- Specify the key under which the LLM output will be stored in each data item.
- Optional: Provide a path to save the processed data as a CSV file.

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    MessageInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"

    inputs = [
        MessageInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input"),
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name", display_name="Model Name", advanced=False, options=MODEL_NAMES, value=MODEL_NAMES[0]
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="openai_api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        BoolInput(name="stream", display_name="Stream", info=STREAM_INFO_TEXT, advanced=True),
        StrInput(
            name="system_message",
            display_name="System Message",
            info="System message to pass to the model.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:
        # self.output_schea is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.openai_api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict)
        seed = self.seed
        model_kwargs["seed"] = seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
        )
        if json_mode:
            output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore

        return output

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return
code.name: code

max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

openai_api_key.name: openai_api_key
openai_api_key.info: The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed

stream.name: stream

system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

code_File-LWAuh.value:
from pathlib import Path

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file loader."
    icon = "file-text"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        data = parse_text_file_to_data(resolved_path, silent_errors)
        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()
code_File-LWAuh.name: code

silent_errors_File-LWAuh.name: silent_errors
silent_errors_File-LWAuh.info: If true, errors will not raise an exception.

code_CustomComponent-hHbc0.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data
import csv
from io import StringIO

class CSVToDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "CSV to Data"
    description = "Convert a CSV string to a list of Data objects"
    icon = "ðŸ“Š"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="csv_string",
            display_name="CSV String",
            info="Enter a valid CSV string to convert to a list of Data objects",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(name="data_list", display_name="Data List", method="convert_csv_to_data"),
    ]

    def convert_csv_to_data(self) -> list[Data]:
        try:
            csv_string = self.csv_string

            # Use StringIO to create a file-like object from the string
            csv_file = StringIO(csv_string)

            # Create a CSV reader object
            csv_reader = csv.DictReader(csv_file)

            # Convert each row to a Data object
            result = []
            for row in csv_reader:
                result.append(Data(data=row))

            self.status = result
            return result

        except csv.Error as e:
            error_message = f"CSV parsing error: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            return [Data(data={"error": error_message})]

        except Exception as e:
            error_message = f"An error occurred: {str(e)}"
            self.status = error_message
            return [Data(data={"error": error_message})]
code_CustomComponent-hHbc0.name: code

code_ParseData-zTvi2.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
code_ParseData-zTvi2.name: code

template_ParseData-zTvi2.name: template
template_ParseData-zTvi2.info: The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.

path.info: Supported file types: txt, md, mdx, csv, json, yaml, yml, xml, html, htm, pdf, docx, py, sh, sql, js, ts, tsx

from pathlib import Path

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file loader."
    icon = "file-text"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        data = parse_text_file_to_data(resolved_path, silent_errors)
        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
